ema.title: EMA {period} Distance Guide
ema.whatItIs: EMA (Exponential Moving Average) {period} is a trend-following indicator that gives more weight to recent prices. It smooths out price action and helps identify the overall trend direction. When price is above EMA, it suggests bullish momentum; below suggests bearish momentum. The distance from EMA indicates how extended the price is from its average.
ema.aboveEma: Price is {distance} points ABOVE EMA ({pct}% above). This indicates bullish momentum - buyers are in control.
ema.belowEma: Price is {distance} points BELOW EMA ({pct}% below). This indicates bearish momentum - sellers are in control.
ema.touchReactionBullish: In an uptrend, EMA often acts as dynamic SUPPORT. Expect a bounce upward. This is a potential BUY zone.
ema.touchReactionBearish: In a downtrend, EMA often acts as dynamic RESISTANCE. Expect rejection downward. This is a potential SELL zone.
ema.breakReactionBullish: Breaking above EMA signals potential trend reversal to bullish. Wait for confirmation before entering.
ema.breakReactionBearish: Breaking below EMA signals potential trend reversal to bearish. Consider reducing long positions.
ema.tip20: EMA 20 is best for short-term trends and scalping. It reacts quickly to price changes.
ema.tip50: EMA 50 is the medium-term trend indicator. Institutional traders watch this level closely.
ema.tip200: EMA 200 is the long-term trend indicator. A price above EMA 200 = bull market, below = bear market.
ema.tipClose: Price is very close to EMA - expect a reaction soon. Watch for bounce or break.
ema.tipFar: Price is extended far from EMA - mean reversion likely. Consider taking profits.
ema.tipMid: Price is at moderate distance from EMA - trend is healthy, no immediate action needed.
ema.tipGeneral: Always confirm EMA signals with volume and other indicators before trading.

channel.title: Trend Channel Guide
channel.whatItIs: A trend channel consists of two parallel lines containing price action - an upper resistance line and a lower support line. Price tends to bounce between these boundaries. Channel width indicates volatility, slope shows trend direction, and R² measures how well price respects the channel.
channel.uptrendStatus: UPTREND channel active with {strength}% strength. Price is moving in a controlled bullish pattern.
channel.downtrendStatus: DOWNTREND channel active with {strength}% strength. Price is moving in a controlled bearish pattern.
channel.upperCondition: If price reaches upper channel boundary
channel.upperReaction: Upper band = RESISTANCE zone. Expect a pullback or consolidation. Consider taking partial profits on longs or look for short entries.
channel.lowerCondition: If price reaches lower channel boundary
channel.lowerReaction: Lower band = SUPPORT zone. Expect a bounce upward. This is an optimal BUY zone within the channel.
channel.breakoutCondition: If price breaks out of channel
channel.breakoutReactionUp: Breakout above upper band = Trend acceleration. New highs likely. Consider adding to long positions.
channel.breakoutReactionDown: Breakdown below lower band = Trend reversal warning. New lows likely. Exit longs, consider shorts.
channel.tipUpperHalf: Price is in the upper half of channel - closer to resistance. Be cautious with new long entries.
channel.tipLowerHalf: Price is in the lower half of channel - closer to support. Better zone for long entries.
channel.tipStrong: Channel has strong R² correlation - boundaries are more reliable for trading decisions.
channel.tipWeak: Channel has weak correlation - boundaries may not hold. Use tighter stops.
channel.tipGeneral: Best strategy: Buy at lower band, sell at upper band. Place stops outside channel boundaries.

sr.whatIsSupport: A SUPPORT level is a price zone where buying pressure historically overwhelms selling pressure, causing price to bounce upward. The more times price has bounced from this level (touches), the stronger and more reliable it becomes. Support acts as a 'floor' for price.
sr.whatIsResistance: A RESISTANCE level is a price zone where selling pressure historically overwhelms buying pressure, causing price to reverse downward. The more times price has rejected from this level (touches), the stronger and more reliable it becomes. Resistance acts as a 'ceiling' for price.
sr.touchSupportCondition: If price reaches this support level
sr.touchSupportReaction: Expect BUYING pressure and a bounce upward. This is a potential LONG entry zone. Place stop-loss below the support level.
sr.touchResistanceCondition: If price reaches this resistance level
sr.touchResistanceReaction: Expect SELLING pressure and a rejection downward. This is a potential SHORT entry zone or profit-taking area for longs.
sr.breakSupportCondition: If price breaks below this support
sr.breakSupportReaction: Support becomes RESISTANCE. Expect further downside. Old support level becomes new short entry zone on retest.
sr.breakResistanceCondition: If price breaks above this resistance
sr.breakResistanceReaction: Resistance becomes SUPPORT. Expect further upside. Old resistance level becomes new long entry zone on retest.
sr.tip1: This level has been tested {hits} times - each touch adds to its significance.
sr.tipClose: Price is very close to this level - expect a reaction within the next few candles.
sr.tipFar: Price is far from this level - no immediate action. Monitor as price approaches.
sr.tipStrong: This is a STRONG level - higher probability of holding. Good for larger position sizes.
sr.tipWeak: This is a WEAK level - may break easily. Use smaller position sizes and tighter stops.

customAnalysis.title: Custom Analysis (Last 100 candles)
customAnalysis.summary: NASDAQ momentum accelerating while XAUUSD remains range-bound.
customAnalysis.insight1: 15m structure shows bullish continuation patterns on NDX.
customAnalysis.insight2: 1h gold structure lacks follow-through; consider mean reversion.
